intro: Pelea sessilis, commonly known as the sessile pelea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually alternate and finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Pelea sessilis is often grown in gardens for its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation.
